column2: richard grabs a bottle of scotch
column3: just as the door closes and carries it with him.)

column1: ross: you’re not getting away this time mister! unless you want that ass kicking we talked about!
ross: hiiii-ya!!  i’m serious! you’re not walking out on my sister!
ross: then where the hell have you been?!

column2: i heard you and rachel talking.

column1: ross: what?! what?! talking about what?!
ross: know what—if somebody doesn’t tell me what’s going on right now…
ross: oh my god. oh my god! and you’re-you’re…you’re not freaking out?
chandler: well i was! then i went down to the gift shop because i was out of cigarettes…
chandler: big picture please! so i was in the gift shop
column2: and that’s when i uh
column3: saw this.  yeah
column4: y’know what? i thought anything that can fit into this

column2: look at how cute and small this is! so i got it to give monica so she’d know i was okay.

column1: mr. geller: way to go son! i knew you’d find him!  chandler’s wedding. we’ve got violins playing every breath you take
column2: we’ve got guests seated

column1: mr. bing: our little boy is getting married.
mrs. bing: oh look at you! so handsome!
chandler: you look beautiful mom.  you look beautiful too dad. i love you both.  i’m so glad you here.
ross: i’ve never walked down the aisle knowing it can’t end in divorce.
mrs. geller: oh i wish you’re grandmother had lived to see this.
mrs. geller: not that old crow
column2: my mother. (they stop and she kisses monica on the cheek.) congratulations darling.

column1: mr. geller: i love you sweetheart.
chandler: you look beautiful. is this new?
the rabbi: i am father kalebasous.
the rabbi: let us begin. dearly beloved…
joey:  i can take it from here
column2: thanks.  dearly beloved
column3: i’m sorry i’m a little late. you may be confused by this now
column4: but you won’t be memorial day weekend 2002. well
column5: let’s get started before the groom takes off again. huh?  we are gathered here today
column6: to join this man and this woman in the bonds of holy matrimony. i’ve known monica and chandler for a long time
column7: and i can not imagine two people more perfect for each other. and now
column8: as i’ve left my notes in my dressing room. we shall proceed to the vows. monica?

column2: for so long i…i wondered if i would ever find my prince
column3: my soul mate. then three years ago
column4: at another wedding i turned to a friend for comfort. and in stead
column5: i found everything that i’d ever been looking for my whole life. and now…here we are…with our future before us…and i only want to spend it with you
column8: my friend. unless you don’t want to. you go!

column1: chandler:  monica i thought this was going to be the most difficult thing i ever gonna had to do. but when i saw you walking down that aisle i realized how simple it was. i love you. any surprises that come our way it’s okay
column2: because i will always love you. you are the person i was meant to spend the rest of my life with. you wanna know if i’m sure? (he leans in and kisses her.)

column1: joey: you may not kiss the bride. so
column2: i guess by the powers vested in my by the state of new york and the internet guys
column3: i now pronounce you husband and wife. oh wait! do you take each other?

column1: joey: aw crap! okay—uh…uh let’s-let’s do the rings.  (chandler and monica both turn
column2: take the rings from ross and rachel respectively
column3: and place them on each other’s fingers.)

column1: joey: we good? yeah? good? once again
column2: i pronounce you husband and wife. (to chandler) now kiss her again.

column1: chandler:  i love you. and i know about the baby.
